item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: dinnsfire5
item.description:
It is sooo scary. It’s based off the same system Amnesia is based off: Since you never actually see Slenderman up close, your mind immediately replaces him with the scariest thing it can think of.

item.title: Slender: Source

item.description:
I played the original Slender recently. It’s not that it’s scary; it’s just really really hard. Like, I could never get any more than 3/8 pages.

item.description:
Jethrosoup:

Just came here to say that I started playing Dead Space recently and it’s the least scary game I’ve ever played. Seriously, it’s not scary at all. Even the jump scares are pretty mild.

It’s better than F.E.A.R.

don’t get me started on DOOM 3

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
You need to try the mod before just immediately saying “co-op aint scary derp”
Who knows. This mod might bring something new that adds to the atmosphere to make up for that so-called “loss of atmosphere in co-op games”.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: Scorch6679
item.description:
YouKnow:

I don’t get it. You fear not being able to beat a game and having to make your own solution for a problem in a game? It seems like you’re saying something like Crayon Physics or a Rubix Cube with its stickers moved to impossible locations is scary to you.

I think he means that there is ALWAYS a way around the obstacle. The game is going to try to present it to you somehow.

As for Amnesia, that stopped being scary after the first time I “died” and realized that all that happens is you get displaced a few feet. So I just abused that repeatedly late game.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: k3nny1550
item.description:
Co-op horror just does not work. It’s not scary in the slightest, and making the game work in co-op kills some of the atmosphere. Look at how F.E.A.R. 3 got butchered to make the game fully co-op. They brought back a dead character in a way that made no sense, there wasn’t a scary sequence in the whole game, and there were just shootouts everywhere. I know it’s presumptuous of me to think that horror cannot be done in co-op, but it’s highly unlikely you’ll manage to pull off the right atmosphere to scare the player when you have some mouth-breathing thirteen year old swearing up a storm in your ear looking for dog tags or coffee mugs. It would have to be like Journey or something, where there’s no voice comm between players, if that.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Dias:

What a shame horror games don’t work as co-op.

What I wouldn’t give for a survival horror game that forces in engine VOIP and puts two players in a maze and separates them while they run from some crazy shit. Their voices would be realistically occluded and reverbed in the environment, meaning that anyone can get abandoned at any time. It also means that the players can unwittingly scare the shit out of each other.
Of course there’d be more than that, but it’s the only way I see COOP horror working.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: YouKnow
item.description:
MDIGN:

It’s kinda hard for me to get scared in a game, mainly because it’s made to be beaten. Weather you have to take a certain route or wait for an enemy to pass, it all was planned to be beaten. If a game gave me the feel that I can never beat it, or something like ARMA where you have to make your own way to beat it, that would be very scary.

Slenderwise, they should make him extrude his arms and attack you at some point. In the freeware version all he does is teleport and look at you. Not really scary if you think about it.

I don’t get it. You fear not being able to beat a game and having to make your own solution for a problem in a game? It seems like you’re saying something like Crayon Physics or a Rubix Cube with its stickers moved to impossible locations is scary to you.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: MDIGN
item.description:
Imonfire:

You should try out Tale of Tales’s “The Path” then. In their interpretation of The Red Riding Hood, there is nothing to “beat”, and you sure as hell do not win anything. It is both beautiful and monstrous, as well as being very scary.

I watched a few vids just now, it’s pretty creepy. It seems like a psychological thriller/ Dark horror thing. It’s very deep with all the different Big bad wolves. I wish they had more tools to make the game’s animation more fluent, it removes the horror from it.

Read full topic

item.description:
gibbelin:

Dead Space takes advantage of the shitty camera placement to score cheap scares.

I’ve been meaning to play Slender, but my PC died the other day. RIP.

I dig creepy imagery. Big Carnival of Souls fan.

I’m interested in this Carnival of Souls thing… I’ve heard it’s a good movie, but do you have any words of persuasion?

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: Dias
item.description:
What a shame horror games don’t work as co-op. It doesn’t help that it’s based off of something as lame as Slenderman. Odds are this game will never get released anyway.

Eion Kilant 739:

Solution: Add weapons.

It’s not a problem that needs to be solved. It’s a feature.

Read full topic

item.title: Slender: Source
item.dc:creator: Imonfire
item.description:
MDIGN:

It’s kinda hard for me to get scared in a game, mainly because it’s made to be beaten. Weather you have to take a certain route or wait for an enemy to pass, it all was planned to be beaten. If a game gave me the feel that I can never beat it, or something like ARMA where you have to make your own way to beat it, that would be very scary.

You should try out Tale of Tales’s “The Path” then. In their interpretation of The Red Riding Hood, there is nothing to “beat”, and you sure as hell do not win anything. It is both beautiful and monstrous, as well as being very scary.
